Posts.Content: Jesse wrote: I am 3 months out from chemo and my aches and pains have been unbearable.  I read an article on Pseudo Rheumatism and am wondering if this could be what I am suffering from.  The article read that this is caused from withdrawal from chemotherapy.  Has anyone been diagnosed with this?  I'm going to call my Onc. tomorrow to see what he thinks, so will let you know. Thanks Jesse Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pseudo Rheumatism Jesse Brendatrue

Posts.Content: Jesse wrote: I'm a month and a half out from my last chemo treatment which was Aug. 30, 2007 and I have been experiencing terrible joint pain.  It seems to be getting worst.  My Oncologist doesn't seem to think that it's related to my chemo.  Has anyone been experiencing these same symptoms?  If so, what have you been taking for it? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Joint pain after chemo Jesse Jesse

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2007 09:24PM Jesse wrote: Thanks for your comment.  I was beginning to think I was the only one hurting.  My Onc doesn't feel that it's from chemo but my breast surgeon feels that it is and should get better with time.  I start Arimidex next week and I'm afraid what the side effects will be.  I understand that it causes aches and pains.
Posts.Title: Joint pain after chemo Jesse Jesse

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2007 10:11PM Jesse wrote: It's a relief to know that I'm not the only one suffering with sore joints.  Sometimes it's almost unbearable especially from a sitting position.  I have been out of chemo since August 30th and started Arimidex on October 22nd.  I go see my onc in January and I'm sure he will take me off of the drug.  I don't think I can live like this for 5 yrs.  I have tried everything, and nothing has worked for me. Jesse
Posts.Title: Joint pain after chemo Jesse Jesse

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2007 04:40PM Jesse wrote: My Onc didn't feel it was from chemo either, but by BS said that it has to be and it should get better with time, but it's getting worst.  I'm having reconstruction done tomorrow so I went in for a pre-op to my regular doctor and he didn't have time for me!!!  Really pissed me off.  I'm thinking of trying acupuncture and Reike to see if that will help. Lorna
Posts.Title: Joint pain after chemo Jesse Jesse

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2007 09:06PM Jesse wrote: I am now almost 3 months out from chemo and my aches and pains are not getting better.  I even tried acupuncture, helped a little, but not enough to continue.  I have heard about Pseudo Rheumatism and am wondering if this is what I have.  What I have read that it is caused from withdrawal from the chemo.  Has anyone heard of this condition?  The article said that it could take six to 12 months for the symptoms to generally abate! Jesse
Posts.Title: Joint pain after chemo Jesse Jesse
